Pre-Game Insights: Burkina Faso will host Malawi in Bamako, Mali, due to a lack of a suitable venue in their home country, adding an extra layer of uncertainty to this tightly poised fixture.

Both teams are desperate to bounce back from less-than-ideal starts to their qualification campaigns. Burkina Faso secured a hard-fought 1-1 draw against Senegal, while Malawi were left ruing a 3-2 defeat at home to Burundi.
Burkina Faso’s solid defensive structure and competitive performance against Senegal provide confidence, despite their winless streak in their last eight outings.
Malawi will be looking to shake off their defensive frailties, especially after conceding three goals at home in a match where they dominated large spells.
Both teams prepare for Sunday’s showdown, with neither side able to afford to slip up if they hope to secure a place in next year’s Africa Cup of Nations.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The best bet for this encounter is Burkina Faso to win and both teams to score, offering good value based on both sides’ recent form and attacking potential.
Featured score prediction: Burkina Faso 2-1 Malawi, reflecting Burkina Faso’s superior quality and depth compared to Malawi’s defensive issues.
